properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 29 at 3:03AM MST until March 1 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Winter Storm Watches Posted for Portions of Central and
Southern Wyoming late tonight through Sunday evening...

.Snow will develop late tonight and continue through the day
Sunday. The snow is likely to persist across southern Wyoming
Sunday evening. The combination of snow and wind could create
hazardous travel in some locations.

* WHAT...Locally heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations
of 3 to 5 inches possible. Northeast wind gusting 25 to 35 mph
is anticipated along US 287 from Beaver Rim to Jeffrey City to
around Muddy Gap.

* WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range.

* WHEN...From late tonight through Sunday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times during the
day Sunday and into Sunday evening. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected to fall
during the day Sunday.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
